list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Remove redundant explosion sound on plane destruction.
The explosion sound is already handled elsewhere, making this call unnecessary. This change ensures no duplicate audio plays and helps streamline the destruction logic.

component.name: RunManager
component.selected: Attach to Unity Editor.Attach to Unity Editor

task.summary:
Refactor scenes and assets structure
Deleted outdated scenes and materials while migrating key files to a new structured directory. Ensured that essential assets like the reflection probe and unity material ball were preserved under the new `_Scenes` folder.

Make passenger handling public and implement airport logic.
Changed passenger addition/removal methods to public for external access. Added logic to populate airports with passengers and transfer them to planes. Enhanced queue management and updated airplanes to handle capacity checks properly.

Add `FlightManager` and enhance passenger handling logic
Introduced `FlightManager` to manage plane movements and interactions with airports. Enhanced passenger handling by adding tooltips, refining capacity checks, and improving transfer logic. Updated scene objects to reflect new capabilities and ensure better structure alignment.

Add `FlightManager` and improve passenger handling logic
Introduced `FlightManager` to handle plane movements and airport interactions. Enhanced passenger handling by refining capacity checks, adding tooltips, and improving transfer logic. Updated related scenes and assets for better structure and alignment.

Add metadata and assets for DOTween Pro editor resources
This commit adds metadata files, textures, and XML documentation for DOTween Pro editor resources. These assets include various images and the DemiEditor.dll with corresponding metadata, enhancing editor functionalities and documentation support.

Update DOTween setup and add FlightInputManager script
Removed outdated DOTweenUpgradeManager files and adjusted DOTween settings to disable physics integration markers. Added new FlightInputManager script to handle airplane and airport interactions in the scene. These changes optimize DOTween functionality while introducing improved input handling features.

Refactor scene objects and update configurations
Removed unused GameObjects and restructured hierarchy for better clarity. Renamed elements like "Mesh" to more descriptive names such as "Airport 1" and "Airplane 1." Applied modifications to MonoBehaviour components, updated object positions, and fine-tuned settings for consistency.

Add basic interaction scripts and quick outline visualization
Introduced `AirportInteractable` and `PlaneInteractable` scripts to handle interactions for planes and airports. Implemented `IInteractable` interface for reusable interaction design. Added the QuickOutline package for selection visualization, including its shaders, materials, and a sample scene.

Remove IInteractable system and related components.
Eliminated the IInteractable interface and its implementations, simplifying the interaction logic. Removed associated scripts (AirportInteractable, PlaneInteractable, and SelectionManager) and properties from related GameObjects. This refactor streamlines the architecture, reducing unnecessary complexity and improving maintainability.

Handle plane explosion and improve airport logic
Added explosion handling for planes with an event notification and cleanup logic. Updated airport behavior to remove planes from current airports properly before departure. Simplified and clarified landing processes with capacity checks and refactored movement logic.

Add prefabs for Airplane 1 and Airport 1
Created new prefabs for "Airplane 1" and "Airport 1" in the project. These include detailed components such as RectTransforms, MonoBehaviours, and rendering settings for both objects. This adds new functionality and assets to the project.

Remove unused assets and update prefab naming for clarity
Deleted outdated "Airport 1" prefab and its meta file, along with the unused `AudioManager` script and its meta file. Renamed "Airport 1" to "Airport" for improved consistency and organization.

Remove redundant explosion sound on plane destruction.
The explosion sound is already handled elsewhere, making this call unnecessary. This change ensures no duplicate audio plays and helps streamline the destruction logic.

Deleted outdated scenes and materials while migrating key files to a new structured directory. Ensured that essential assets like the reflection probe and unity material ball were preserved under the new `_Scenes` folder.
